bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence Reed, Blossom Reed, Houston Lazear, [Peggy Lazear] Briggs, Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, Robert P. Cooke, James Hanberry, Albert G. Love, J.F. Siler, [Cornelia Knox] Kean, and Maria Teresa Rojas, October 8, 1952

div1.p: Hench informs his friends that the dedication of Camp Lazear has been postponed until December 3, 1952, which is Finlay's birthday and “Physicians' Day” in Havana. He is still concerned that the praise for Finlay might overshadow the doctors and volunteers who worked at Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence Reed, Blossom Reed, Houston Lazear, [Peggy Lazear] Briggs, Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, Robert P. Cooke, James Hanberry, Albert G. Love, J.F. Siler, [Cornelia Knox] Kean, and Maria Teresa Rojas, October 8, 1952
div1.p:
I have just heard from Dr. Pedro Nogueira of Marianao that the dedication of old
Camp Lazear has been postponed until December 3. Since the camp and the bronze
plaques could not be finished by the end of September in time for an international
congress which was held in Havana the end of September, Doctor Nogueira had hoped
to have the camp dedicated on November 20 which was the date when the camp was
originally opened for business. But members of the committee voted to dedicate
it on December 3, the birthday of Doctor Finlay and “Physicians' Day” in Havana.
I am still hoping that the praise for Finlay will not completely overshadow
that for the men who actually did the work at Camp Lazear, but frankly, I am a
little worried. Doctor Nogueira has written saying that the designation on the
blueprint, Caseta de Finlay, was certainly an error and that it must be known
as Building No. 1 of the U. S. Yellow Fever Board. He was not precise in telling
me of the name for the Park and I suspect that they may still name it Parque
Finlay rather than Parque Lazear or Campemento Lazear, but I am still working
on him regarding this.

Doctor Nogueira tells me that the bronze medallions of Finlay, Delgado, Wood,
Reed, Carroll, Lazear and Agramonte are in process of being made and that the
bronze plaques with the volunteers names are about to be made.

Doctor Nogueira assures me that the appropriate people will be invited officially
in due time. He has the list of my suggestions which includes the names listed
below.

I regret that Senora Rojas, the owner of the Finca San Jose (but not now the owner
of the land on which Camp Lazear stands) has been in Europe. She is most anxious
to have the historical record kept accurate. She has just written me from Europe
and will be back in Cuba in mid-November. She, Senora Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon
and other Cuban friends will keep me informed of the situation.

The Surgeon General will try to go himself if the date is appropriate; otherwise
he expects to designate Major General Streit, Head of Walter Reed Hospital, if
and when invitations are received.
div1.closer:
Always sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
